page.title: 16FARMS - MARTON & NUNTHORPE
page.content: In the whole of the area there are 7 farms.{Eastfields Farm}has 225.9 acres. There are 9 fields varying from 36 acres to 104 acres in size. Land use is grazing and crops such as wheat, barley and peas. Corn is grown on 130 acres. There are some Friesian cows, sometimes fed with silage. The farm house was built in 1860. Mechanical farming equipment includes a grain drier, used if there is too much moisture in the grain.{Bonny {Grove Farm}has a 200 year old farmhouse with 8 rooms, 4 upstairs and 4 down. A corn loft where corn used to be stored is above the kitchen door. 12 outbuildings now store crops. 8 or 9 people work there with more hired at harvest time. The farm has 150 acres. Crops grown are barley, wheat, oats and grass. Some crops are sold, some kept to feed the farm animals.
